conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an isometric cutaway with extruded walls, visible wall thickness, perceivable interior volumes, and ceiling/roof removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion, readable corners and floor/wall separation; cutaway is clean and viewing angle is appropriately elevated/isometric with minimal distortion.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint and main zoning (living bottom-left, kitchen/dining bottom-right, bedrooms toward top/right, bath near top-center) are similar, but the top-left area appears re-partitioned (2D shows one room with two beds; 3D shows two separate rooms/uses), and several interior wall/door placements do not precisely match the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, sofa, dining table, kitchen blocks; bathroom fixture), but some room identities/furnishings appear swapped or simplified (e.g., two-bed bedroom not represented as in 2D).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/openings are legible with consistent materials and no obvious mesh breaks; lighting/background are clean and do not obscure geometry.

detected_errors.description: Top-left bedroom configuration differs: 2D indicates a single room with two beds, while 3D appears subdivided into two rooms/uses, altering adjacency and partition geometry.
Several door/opening positions and/or swing/orientation appear inconsistent with the 2D plan when comparing interior partitions and entries.
Furniture-to-room mapping is not fully faithful (some rooms furnished differently than implied in 2D, including bedroom/office assignments).

summary: A true and clean 3D cutaway conversion is achieved, but notable partition/room-configuration deviations—especially in the top-left bedroom zone—reduce layout fidelity.
